sec.p: Data on rainfall for Łódź during the study seasons were obtained from http://www.tutiempo.net/en/Climate/Lodz (Tutiempo Network, S.L., Madrid, Spain), a Web site containing records provided by the state weather station located in Łódź. We calculated individual total rainfall for every brood as a sum of daily rainfall during the period starting on March 1 and ending 20 days after the hatch of a given brood. Those sums were used as indicators of rainfall intensity, thus indirectly influencing the level of pollutants in the food of particular broods. For both great and blue tits, we assumed that fledglings leave the nest on the day 20 day after hatch (Gibb 1950; Gosler 1993).
